questions.question: What is a common cause of back wheel shaking?
questions.answer: It can be caused by worn out rear wheel bearings, an insecure axle, or a buckled wheel rim.
wrongAnswers: Excessive air in the front tire.
Loose front fork.
Bent pedals.

questions.question: What does it mean when the front tire swings slightly to the right and then to the left?
questions.answer: It is a type of wobble caused by instability in the front wheel.
wrongAnswers: It means the tire is fully balanced.
The rear wheel is under-inflated.
The frame is misaligned.

questions.question: What is one effect of brackets in a wheel system?
questions.answer: They influence the stability and alignment of the wheel assembly.
wrongAnswers: They determine tire pressure.
They change the color of the rim.
They are used to slow down the vehicle.

questions.question: How do wheels help in daily life?
questions.answer: They allow the rider to roll over the ground with great speed and efficiency.
wrongAnswers: They are mainly for decoration.
They help in lifting heavy weights vertically.
They store fuel energy.
